author: jmozah
content:
when EL is syncing and we try to to get`ethclient.SyncProgress` from Geth, we get this error
```
error=json: cannot unmarshal string into Go struct field SyncProgress.CurrentBlock of type uint64
```

author: mariusvanderwijden
content: We changed the format of the sync progress jnternally to better reflect what is going on with snap sync and didn't update the ethclient yet. Will fix

author: redpill_tw
content: I am running merge-devnet-3 with geth and lighthouse. All looks good apart from this repeating error.ERROR[12-15|08:34:56.160] Snapshot extension registration failed   peer=968fed87 err="peer connected on snap without compatible eth support"

content:

author: mariusvanderwijden
content:
This is a known issue. Since a lot of projects are forking geth, they will rename the networking protocol `eth` to something else. 
If they connect to your node, we will reject them, because they have `snap` but not `eth` network protocols and throw this error.
It should be downgraded to a warning, but there's some additional complexity. Best to just ignore it.

author: mariusvanderwijden
content: <@!316784424593129472> Your screenshots already look really useful to me. Would be great to also get info about the head blocks, (`eth.getBlock("latest")`) maybe bad blocks?, total difficulty, last pow block hash/ number of merge block

author: parithosh
content: yea that would be useful, especially when there are bad blocks. Also how many ELs and CLs can we connect to this? Is the idea that it represents info from 1 client or a bunch?

author: parithosh
content: fyi, i'd be taking down the 2 week's old devnet `merge-devnet-2` later today if there's no objection. So all testing should happen on `merge-devnet-3`(last weeks) and eventually on `kintsugi` from tomorrow.

author: johns4
content: Code is available here https://github.com/jgresham/ethvis, ipfs link here too. Documentation needs some work, but there are a few commands documented to get it running https://github.com/jgresham/ethvis#run-ethvis-locally.
